p: Lambrecht et al. [ 198] tested the EO and hydroalcoholic extract from the aerial parts of the plant through a broth microdilution assay to determine the MIC. Although all plant samples showed antimicrobial activity, the hydroalcoholic extracts showed the most satisfactory results with all bacterial species. The T. minuta EO showed antimicrobial activity against all Gram-positive bacteria with EO percentage activities of 1.3% for S. aureus, 0.6% for Staphylococcus coagulase (+), 2.5% for S. coagulase (âˆ’), and 0.8% for S. uberis. On the other hand, for Gram-negative bacteria, the percentage activity values were 4.0% for P. aeruginosa and 5.0% for E. coli.
